channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Droy's Court intentionally making footpath difficult to use, 18th July
item.description:
Throughout the year the paths are intentionally left flooded/deep mud to dissuade users. Cows are intimidating and on all footpaths through farm. Currently there are trees piled up against the footpath gate. Unpleasant atmosphere to put off public footpath users.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Double yellow lines not visible, 17th July
item.description:
The double yellow lines between 54 Leckhampton Road and 62 Leckhampton Road are very faded/not visible in places. When Leckhampton Road was resurfaced they only repainted yellow lines on the new surface. The new bright lines that end abruptly make the old faded lines almost invisible. This is dangerous by the traffic island.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: DRain on Clarence Road and into Winchcombe treet are blocked with tree debris, whilst being told they're regularly checked, there is no evidence this has been done since last years flooding, 17th July
item.description:
The drains outside No 1 Clarence Road and around the corner outside 124 Winchcombe Street where all drains are full of tree debris. These blocked drains caused property flooding last year when the fire brigade were called out and are likely to do the same again this year unless the drains are cleared as a matter of urgency.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clarence Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road signs blocking the road., 17th July
item.description:
At the roundabout at the junction of High Street Prestbury and Southam Road. There are previous outstanding reports of similar blockages but relating to a different closed road in Winchcombe. The latest ones were seen being placed by contractors at about 18:30 Wed 16 July. They were positioned within 10 yards of the roundabout (on Southam Rd) and completely blocking the left hand lane so as to cause traffic to give way to traffic coming into Prestbury/ proceed with caution. They warn that the B4632 Broadway Road is closed 5 miles ahead and sign a diversion. There are two further such notices along Southam Road, at Shaw Lane and New Road turnings. These latter do not obstruct the road. The current positioning is dangerous and likely to lead to an accident. Have you informed the police of the positioning in advance, and gained their approval? Or are you happy to bear the cost of accident claims? If signs MUST be placed at the junction kindly ensure they DO NOT obstruct the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southam Road, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Green filter arrow not working, 17th July
item.description:
Left filter green light onto upper promenade/montpellier from town hall direction not working at about 1440 today 17 July 2025. Waited through entire light cycle and into the next one with traffic queuing and honking behind me.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 118, Promenade, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
